account package¶

Submodules¶

account.account module¶

class account.account.account(*args)[source]¶

Bases: tranaction

_The Account class includes methods to manage the balance of a bank account._

Args:

transaction (transaction): abstract class that defines methods that may be implemented by an account class.

__init__(*args)[source]¶

Constructs an account with a specified balacne if args length is 1, else constructs an account with a balcne of 0.

Variables:

__balance – balance of this account

Raises:

ValueError: indicates arg[0] is less than 0.

privateMethod()[source]¶
protectedMethod()[source]¶
publicMethod()[source]¶
getBalance()[source]¶

Returns the balance of the calling account.

Returns:

float: the balance

isEmpty()[source]¶

Checks if the balance for the calling account is zero.

Returns:

Boolean: True if the balacne for the calling account is zero, else False.

credit(amount: float)[source]¶

Increases the balance of the calling account by the specified amount.

Args:

amount (float): the amount to increase the balance by

Raises:

ValueError: indicates the specied amount is less than zero.

debit(amount: float)[source]¶

Decreases the balance of the calling account by the specified amount.

Args:

amount (float): the amount to decrease the balance by

Raises:

ValueError: indicates the specified amount is less than 0 ValueError: indicates the specified amount is greater than the balance of the calling account

__str__()[source]¶

Returns string representation of the calling account. Returns:

str: string representation of the calling account

__eq__(other)[source]¶

Tests if the calling account is equal to the specified object. Args:

other: the specified object

Returns:

Boolean: True if the calling account is equal to the specified object, else False

static sum(account1, account2)[source]¶

Adds the balances of two account objects if the account objects are not null. Args:

account1 (account): account object account2 (account): account object

Returns:

float: sum of balances if two account objects are not None, else 0.0.

static transfer(a, amount: float)[source]¶

Adds the specified amount to a new account object and debits the amount from the specified account object. Args:

a (account): specified account object to be debited amount (float): debit amount

Raises:

ValueError: indicates debit amount is less than zero ValueError: indicates account is None ValueError: indicates account is not an account type ValueError: indicates debit amount is greater than the balance in the specified account object to be debited

Returns:

account: new account object
